summary: The 'Safeguarding American Education From Foreign Control Act' amends the Higher Education Act of 1965 to require increased disclosure of gifts and contracts from foreign sources to educational institutions. It mandates institutions to report gifts or contracts exceeding a threshold value ($250,000 for non-covered nations or any value for covered nations) to the Secretary of Education. The Secretary must forward these reports to the FBI and Director of National Intelligence. Additionally, the Secretary of Education is required to transmit existing records related to foreign gifts to the FBI and DNI.
